SEARCH
Package sprouts

Interface WeakObserver<O>

Type Parameters:
O - The type of the owner of this observer.
All Superinterfaces:
Observer, Subscriber
public interface WeakObserver<O> extends Observer
A weak observer is an extension of the Observer interface which defines a method for clearing its state (setting it to null) and a method for retrieving the owner of the observer.
The owner is weakly referenced and determines the lifetime of the observer. A library internal cleaner is responsible for removing it from the Observable when the owner is garbage collected. It is advised to use the Observer.ofWeak(Object, java.util.function.Consumer) factory method to create a new weak observer which is backed by a tried and test default implementation of this interface.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    clear()
    Clears the observer, making it no longer executable.
    Optional<O>
    owner()
    Returns an Optional containing the owner of this observer.

    Methods inherited from interface sprouts.Observer

    andThen, invoke

  • Method Details

    • owner

      Optional<O> owner()
      Returns an Optional containing the owner of this observer. If the owner is no longer available, then an empty Optional is returned.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the owner of this observer.

    • clear

      void clear()
      Clears the observer, making it no longer executable. This method is called by the library internal cleaner when the owner is garbage collected.
      It is not advised to call this method manually, as it may lead to unexpected behavior.
